image.altText: A teenage boy holding a softball bat and glove, looking sad.

props.synopsis: It was a schoolyard sport so common it once rivalled cricket as the most popular in Australia. But now grassroots teams are struggling to fill a team sheet.

title.children: Australia were world champs, now teams are scrambling for players

image.altText: Chenice Jordan

props.synopsis: Female participation in rugby league across the Canberra region has reached a record high. Despite this, both women's teams in Queanbeyan have been forced to fold mid-season due to a player shortage.

title.children: The footy club with a $600,000 female change room but no women's team

image.altText: A blonde woman in a blue blazer.

props.synopsis: Documents obtained by the ABC under a freedom of information request reveal that a complaint about Leanne Castley was formally lodged on June 25, though it was later withdrawn.

title.children: Complaint lodged then withdrawn against ACT Opposition Leader

image.altText: Three in scenery

props.synopsis: In the 41 years since the first Australians summitted Mount Everest, the mountain has been transformed into a tourist attraction. Does the original magic still exist? Â

title.children: The 'Australian Route' up Mt Everest that may never be repeated

image.altText: The sign out of the front of the building and the crest, with an autumnal tree nearby and a blue sky beyond.

props.synopsis: A prisoner has been sentenced to additional jail time, after admitting to biting off part of the ear of another inmate during a fight after a volleyball game.

title.children: Prisoner sentenced after biting off inmate's ear after volleyball game

image.altText: The exterior of a concrete court building.

props.synopsis: Details of a sophisticated drug distribution system run by a teenager emerge after she pleads guilty to charges including attempting to possess a marketable quantity of cocaine.

title.children: Teen's sophisticated drug distribution system revealed by her notes app

image.altText: Magpie thumbail

props.synopsis: A Canberra man has captured footage of the dramatic moment a magpie plucked his earphone from his ear.

title.children: Canberra cyclist captures moment magpie steals earphone from ear

image.altText: illustration of a judge in a red cape and wig with face a screen of mathematical symbols

props.synopsis: Artificial intelligence is coming for the law. Are we ready for robots to become judge and jury?

title.children: Lawyers are using AI. What will happen when judges do?

image.altText: Aluminum containers containing rice, tofu, fried fish, vegetables, and melon slices.

props.synopsis: The key election commitment of President Prabowo Subianto is facing mounting backlash over its poor oversight, questionable food sourcing and unhygienic kitchens.

title.children: Indonesia's free meal program poisons thousands of children

image.altText: Sean Diddy Combs looking at something with sunglasses on

props.synopsis: Sean "Diddy" Combs may have just been sentenced to four years in prison, but he still faces a mountain of lawsuits accusing him of sexual violence and other misconduct.

title.children: Here's what's next for Sean 'Diddy' Combs now he's been sentenced to four years in prison

image.altText: Reece Walsh takes a shot at goal during an NRL game.

props.synopsis: Kick-off times, pre-game entertainment and all the players taking the field. Here's everything you need to know for grand final day in Sydney.

title.children: What time are the NRL and NRLW grand finals?

image.altText: Andrew Hastie speaks in a corridor in Parliament House

props.synopsis: Hastie says he decided to quit because a letter she sent him earlier in the week made clear he wouldn't be formulating the Coalition's immigration policies.

title.children: Andrew Hastie's resignation could not be worse timing for Sussan Ley

image.altText: An illustration showing figures of people in a parliament setting with blue and red symbols above their heads.

props.synopsis: In Australian politics, words and phrases used in parliament that are seen as insulting, abusive, or a deliberate lie are determined to be "unparliamentary language".

title.children: From 'snotty nose' to 'yahoos': The language banned from parliament

image.altText: Close up of a blood red moon.

props.synopsis: Can a full moon affect your periods? A new study suggests there's a link, but others say there's little evidence. We look at the facts and debunk some myths.

title.children: Menstrual myths debunked: What does your cycle sync with?

image.altText: gas flares from pipes in the air

props.synopsis: The Browse gas project is staring down the full weight of Australia's climate movement. Analysts say that is the least of its worries.

title.children: Financial analysts cast doubt on mega Woodside gas project

image.altText: A woman with a dog standing next to a placard saying a home is for sale.

props.synopsis: Councillors say they recognise that small housing is needed to meet housing demand, but state government support will be needed to build key infrastructure.Â

title.children: Single-person households, couples with fewer kids want smaller homes

image.altText: Tom in a blue suit behind a podium with a shocked face. Hard Quiz Kids logo in the top right corner

props.synopsis: I find it interesting you think you could beat the know-it-all tweens on Hard Quiz Kids. How about you prove it? Let's play, HARD!

title.children: Are these pipsqueaks smarter than you? Let's play, HARD!

image.altText: A close-up shot of a man with an ecstatic expression.

props.synopsis: The party of billionaire and self-declared "Trumpist" Andrej BabiÅ¡ wins the Czech Republic's parliamentary election, near-final results show, which could steer the country away from supporting Ukraine.

title.children: Populist billionaire Andrej BabiÅ¡ wins Czech parliamentary election

image.altText: Sailors and women on the Rotor at Sydney's Luna Park in the 1940s.

props.synopsis: Now in its 90th year, Sydney's Luna Park was not always so family-friendly.Â

title.children: How war brought out the dark side of Sydney's Luna Park

image.altText: A man helps a woman down from the window of a badly-damaged building, with smoke rising around

props.synopsis: Ali Jadallah's photo, called Leaving Home, shows three people emerging from the rubble of their damaged building.

title.children: See all the winners from the Siena Awards Photo Festival

image.altText: Alex De Minaur leaps while serving on a court that reads SHANGHAI behind him.

props.synopsis: Alex de Minaur sets a new personal record for wins in a year with a comfortable victory over Camilo Ugo Carabelli at the Shanghai Masters.

title.children: De Minaur hits career-best mark with win at Shanghai Masters

image.altText: A blue metal train carriage exterior surrounded by charred broken wood and with orange flames and smoke seen through a window

props.synopsis: A Russian drone strike has hit a passenger train in Ukraine's northern Sumy region and injured dozens of people in an act President Volodymyr Zelenskyy has denounced as 'terrorism'.

title.children: Russian strike hits Ukrainian passenger train, authorities say

image.altText: Students and a robot with two people on the screen in a classroom.

props.synopsis: A national program that places robots in classrooms so students can learn from home will from Monday expand its work across Tasmania.

title.children: Virtual learning robot provides 'immeasurable' outcomes in school trial

image.altText: A group of rugby players wrestle for the ball in wet conditions

props.synopsis: Australia's hopes of an unlikely Rugby Championship triumph have been extinguished with a 28-14 loss to New Zealand.

title.children: Professional All Blacks outclass Wallabies at wet and wild Perth Stadium

image.altText: A man wearing dark blue police uniform

props.synopsis: While Premier Jacinta Allan narrows in on machetes and bail laws, Chief Commissioner Mike Bush is looking to broader horizons as Victoria witnesses record levels of offending.

title.children: Victoria's police chief is forging his own path to fight record crime

image.altText: A lady with short black hair sitting in-front of a microphone

props.synopsis: The decision comes after the Prime Minister Shigeru Ishiba announced his resignation last month.

title.children: Sanae Takaichi likely to become Japan's first female PM

image.altText: Man stands and looks at camera in a dairy shed.

props.synopsis: Some South Australian farmers say they are still feeling the strain of drought after inconsistent winter rains left little room for recovery before the coming summer.

title.children: South Australian farmers 'on knife edge' ahead of summer after a year of dry conditions

image.altText: The bronze statue sits in the red sand with a metal detector in the background

props.synopsis: A Ming Dynasty Buddha statue found on a roadside in Western Australia's Shark Bay region seven years ago could soon be repatriated to the largest Buddhist population in the world.

title.children: Accidental treasure hunters want to send ancient Buddha statue 'home'

image.altText: A man in a suit points and looks on.

props.synopsis: A Queensland man is charged with using a carriage service to make a threat to kill after he allegedly made a threat on Anthony Albanese's life on social media.

title.children: Man charged over alleged death threat to prime minister

image.altText: A photo of people wearing black shirts with prints, holding protest signs, photos and flowers

props.synopsis: Around 600 people attend a justice march for Kaiden Morgan-Johnston, who died after he was allegedly stabbed while walking to a friend's house in Morwell.

title.children: Community unites to demand justice for beloved Aboriginal dancer

image.altText: A man stands by a car in the desert holding a rifle and a handgun.

props.synopsis: One Battle After Another, starring Leonardo DiCaprio, uses the ever-turning wheel of political violence as a backdrop for a screwball adventure.

title.children: Paul Thomas Anderson's latest movie already eyed for Best Picture

image.altText: Soccer players in red and blue celebrate scoring a goal

props.synopsis: The Newcastle Jets have defeated semi-professional club Heidelberg United 3-1 to claim their first silverware since 2008.

title.children: Jets down Heidelberg to win Australia Cup

image.altText: Oscar Piastri holds a small microphone up towards George Russell as the pair chat.

props.synopsis: Oscar Piastri pronounces himself satisfied after finishing third in qualifying to gain an advantage over fifth-placed teammate Lando Norris at the Singapore GP.

title.children: Piastri satisfied with advantage over Norris in Singapore qualifying

image.altText: 10 singers from the Tallis Scholars sing in the round in front of an ornate gold altar. Peter Phillips conducts in front.

props.synopsis: This English vocal group took centuries-old church music from the archives and became a hit. They're back in Australia sharing this music with local audiences.Â

title.children: One of the world's best vocal groups is sharing centuries-old music on their Australian tour
